result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham J Siegel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Abraham J Siegel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Abraham J Siegel was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Abraham J Siegel was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: W/H adjudication on ct 1. Upon completion of probation on cts 2 & 3, def can petition for dismisscal of ct 1. Completion includes no new violations rising to the level of probable cause.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:46
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Payal Khandhar.  Shelly Rusch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12

Defendant appeared.  Joseph E Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
